subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Floors must be designed and constructed in a way that is appropriate for the activities conducted on the food premises.

ol.li: be able to be effectively cleaned; and
be unable to absorb grease, food particles or water; and
be laid so that there is no ponding of water; and
to the extent that is practicable, be unable to provide harbourage for pests.

callout.p: The requirements for floors apply to the floors of all areas used for food handling, cleaning, sanitising and personal hygiene except the following areas—

ol.li: other areas to which members of the public usually have access.

callout.p: The following floors do not have to comply with TAS I4P8(2)—

ol.li: floors of temporary food premises, including ground surfaces, that are unlikely to pose any risk of contamination of food handled on the food premises; and
floors of food premises that are unlikely to pose any risk of contamination of food handled on the food premises provided the food business has obtained approval for their use.
